intro: Collomia linearis var. boulderensis, commonly known as the Boulder flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This variety is notable for its horticultural value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
